# Automatically Generated Reformat Planes in 3D Slicer

**Topic ID**: 40804
**Date**: 2024-12-19
**URL**: https://discourse.slicer.org/t/automatically-generated-reformat-planes-in-3d-slicer/40804

---

## Post #1 by @Yen-Chen (2024-12-19 16:05 UTC)

<p>The image below shows a screenshot of the reformat plane generated automatically by 3D Slicer. As you can see, I haven’t made any changes after loading the DICOM file. However, the generated reformat plane appears rotated and tilted relative to the 3D cube frame.</p>
<p>My questions are:</p>
<ol>
<li>What criteria or principles does 3D Slicer use to generate these reformat planes?</li>
<li>Why is the reformat plane misaligned with the 3D cube frame, as shown in the pink lines?</li>
</ol>
<p>I’d appreciate any insights or suggestions to better understand or resolve this issue!</p>
